RUNE (ALIAS)
RUNE (ALIAS)
Â¶
TYPE
RUNE
: UTF8.|dRUNE|
The term
rune
appears in the libraries and source code, and means exactly the same as âunicode code pointâ,
with one interesting addition.
This library defines the word
rune
as an alias for the type
DINT
,
so programs can be clear when an integer value represents a code point.
Moreover, what you might think of as a character constant is called a rune constant.
The type and value of the expression
WSTRING#"â"
is a rune with the integer value
DINT#16#2318
.
